data.title: No water for Pakistan from ‘Indian rivers’: Modi
data.description: • AGP Awan says Islamabad willing to discuss water sharing deal • Senate panel slams India’s ‘provocative action’ NEW DELHI: Pakistan will not get water from rivers over which India has rights, Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Thursday, a month after a deadly attack in India-held Kashmir led New Delhi to suspend a key river water-sharing treaty between the neighbours. The attorney general for Pakistan, in an interview with Reuters , responded that Islam­abad remained willing to discuss water sharing between the neighbours but said India must stick to the decades-old treaty. The suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty (IWT), negotiated by the World Bank in 1960, was among a slew of measures announced by India against Pakistan last month after the April 22 Pahalgam attack that killed 26 people. New Delhi had said the attack was backed by Pakistan, an accusation Islamabad den­ied and the nuclear-armed neig­hbours were involved in their worst military fighting in nearly three decades before agreeing to a ceasefire on May 10. “Pakistan will have to pay a heavy price for every terrorist attack … Pakistan’s army will pay it, Pakistan’s economy will pay it,” Modi said at a public event in the northwestern state of Rajasthan, which borders Pakistan. The Indus treaty provides water for 80 per cent of Pakistan’s farms from three rivers that flow from India but Pakistan’s finance minister said this month that its suspension was not going to have “any immediate impact”. The AGP, Mansoor Usman Awan, told Reuters that Pakistan is “willing to talk about or to address anything”. He said India had written to Pakistan in recent weeks, citing population growth and clean energy needs as reasons to modify the treaty. But he said any discussions would have to take part under the terms of the treaty. The treaty is legally binding and no party can unilaterally suspend it, Awan said. “As far as Pakistan is concerned, the treaty is very much operational, functional, and anything which India does, it does at its own cost and peril as far as the building of any hydroelectric power projects are concerned,” he added. The ceasefire between the countries has largely held, with Indian Foreign Minister Subrahmanyam Jaishankar saying there is no exchange of fire currently and “there has been some repositioning of forces accordingly”. “The (military) operation continues because there is a clear message…that if there are acts of the kind we saw on April 22, there will be a response, we will hit the terrorists,” Jaishankar told Dutch news outlet NOS . “If the terrorists are in Pakistan, we will hit them where they are,” he added. Senate committee Meanwhile, the Senate Standing Committee on Water Resources on Thu­rs­day said India’s actions threatening Pakistan’s water security were “illegal”. The committee members warned Pakistan would not tolerate such provocations. The meeting, presided over by Senator Shahadat Awan, discussed the IWT in the light of India’s actions. Pakistan Commissioner for Indus Waters Mehar Ali Shah briefed the panel on the issue. He said the treaty was a bilateral agreement between Pakistan and India and cannot be held in abeyance unilaterally. The committee unanimously condemned India’s “unlawful and unilateral” declaration of holding the treaty 1960 in abeyance. “This provocative action would lead to a dangerous escalation and direct threat to the water security, agricultural productivity and livelihoods of 250 million Pakistani citizens that cannot be tolerated by Pakistan”, said the committee in a unanimous statement. It said the World Bank president had also recently endorsed that the international agreement could not be held in abeyance by one party and continued. “The committee is of the view that the treaty remains in force and must be implemented in letter and spirit.” The members vowed to “vigorously defend” Pakistan’s rights under the treaty at all international forums. This treaty is critically important for Pakistan as a lower-riparian state whose food security and agricultural productivity depend on consistent access to these waters, especially given our increasing climate vulnerability and erratic monsoon cycles, the committee observed. The committee also condemned India’s attack on the Neelum Jehlum project, calling the action “nothing less than water warfare and aggression”. “India’s weaponisation of the Indus Waters Treaty constitutes a red line for the people of Pakistan and the continued interference with Pakistan’s rightful water access under the treaty could threaten the recently established ceasefire between the two countries”, the panel asserted. The meeting called upon the international community to take immediate notice of India’s aggression. “We urge all responsible members of the global community to impress upon India, the importance of honoring its international obligations.” The panel reaffirmed that Pakistan was committed to a peaceful resolution of all outstanding issues with India, including the dispute over Jammu and Kashmir. However, Pakistan “will not compromise on existential water rights”. With input from Reuters Khaleeq Kiani in Islamabad also contributed to this report Published in Dawn, May 23rd, 2025

The attorney general for Pakistan, in an interview with Reuters , responded that Islam­abad remained willing to discuss water sharing between the neighbours but said India must stick to the decades-old treaty. The suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty (IWT), negotiated by the World Bank in 1960, was among a slew of measures announced by India against Pakistan last month after the April 22 Pahalgam attack that killed 26 people. New Delhi had said the attack was backed by Pakistan, an accusation Islamabad den­ied and the nuclear-armed neig­hbours were involved in their worst military fighting in nearly three decades before agreeing to a ceasefire on May 10. “Pakistan will have to pay a heavy price for every terrorist attack … Pakistan’s army will pay it, Pakistan’s economy will pay it,” Modi said at a public event in the northwestern state of Rajasthan, which borders Pakistan. The Indus treaty provides water for 80 per cent of Pakistan’s farms from three rivers that flow from India but Pakistan’s finance minister said this month that its suspension was not going to have “any immediate impact”. The AGP, Mansoor Usman Awan, told Reuters that Pakistan is “willing to talk about or to address anything”. He said India had written to Pakistan in recent weeks, citing population growth and clean energy needs as reasons to modify the treaty. But he said any discussions would have to take part under the terms of the treaty. The treaty is legally binding and no party can unilaterally suspend it, Awan said. “As far as Pakistan is concerned, the treaty is very much operational, functional, and anything which India does, it does at its own cost and peril as far as the building of any hydroelectric power projects are concerned,” he added. The ceasefire between the countries has largely held, with Indian Foreign Minister Subrahmanyam Jaishankar saying there is no exchange of fire currently and “there has been some repositioning of forces accordingly”. “The (military) operation continues because there is a clear message…that if there are acts of the kind we saw on April 22, there will be a response, we will hit the terrorists,” Jaishankar told Dutch news outlet NOS . “If the terrorists are in Pakistan, we will hit them where they are,” he added. Senate committee Meanwhile, the Senate Standing Committee on Water Resources on Thu­rs­day said India’s actions threatening Pakistan’s water security were “illegal”. The committee members warned Pakistan would not tolerate such provocations. The meeting, presided over by Senator Shahadat Awan, discussed the IWT in the light of India’s actions. Pakistan Commissioner for Indus Waters Mehar Ali Shah briefed the panel on the issue. He said the treaty was a bilateral agreement between Pakistan and India and cannot be held in abeyance unilaterally. The committee unanimously condemned India’s “unlawful and unilateral” declaration of holding the treaty 1960 in abeyance. “This provocative action would lead to a dangerous escalation and direct threat to the water security, agricultural productivity and livelihoods of 250 million Pakistani citizens that cannot be tolerated by Pakistan”, said the committee in a unanimous statement. It said the World Bank president had also recently endorsed that the international agreement could not be held in abeyance by one party and continued. “The committee is of the view that the treaty remains in force and must be implemented in letter and spirit.” The members vowed to “vigorously defend” Pakistan’s rights under the treaty at all international forums. This treaty is critically important for Pakistan as a lower-riparian state whose food security and agricultural productivity depend on consistent access to these waters, especially given our increasing climate vulnerability and erratic monsoon cycles, the committee observed. The committee also condemned India’s attack on the Neelum Jehlum project, calling the action “nothing less than water warfare and aggression”. “India’s weaponisation of the Indus Waters Treaty constitutes a red line for the people of Pakistan and the continued interference with Pakistan’s rightful water access under the treaty could threaten the recently established ceasefire between the two countries”, the panel asserted. The meeting called upon the international community to take immediate notice of India’s aggression. “We urge all responsible members of the global community to impress upon India, the importance of honoring its international obligations.” The panel reaffirmed that Pakistan was committed to a peaceful resolution of all outstanding issues with India, including the dispute over Jammu and Kashmir. However, Pakistan “will not compromise on existential water rights”. With input from Reuters Khaleeq Kiani in Islamabad also contributed to this report Published in Dawn, May 23rd, 2025

data.title: PM Shehbaz pledges swift reforms, resolves to benefit from World Bank help
data.description: • Meets IMF delegation, says country on road to economic progress • Govt seeks relief measures in budget; Fund reviewing proposals ISLAMABAD: Amid week-long talks with the International Monetary Fund (IMF) on next fiscal year’s budget, Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif on Thursday reaffirmed Pakistan’s commitment to fast-track institutional reforms and maintain macroeconomic stability. During a meeting with an IMF delegation led by Regional Director for the Middle East and South Asia, Jihad Azour, the prime minister said the country was now firmly on the path of economic development after a period of recovery and stability. “By the grace of Allah, Pakistan is now moving from economic stability towards sustainable growth,” PM Shehbaz said in an official statement. He said the government’s top priority was to sustain macroeconomic gains and expedite comprehensive institutional reforms, crucial for long-term resilience. The high-level meeting took place at the last leg of negotiations between an IMF staff mission and Pakistan’s economic team to finalise next year’s budget in line with commitments made as part of the $7 billion Extended Fund Facility. The IMF mission has been in formal engagements with authorities since May 14 and is slated to conclude the visit on Friday (May 23). The Fund wants the initial achievements under the programme to move into the next phase without compromising programme objectives. Central to that phase include effective implementation of Agricultural Income Tax across provinces, tangible recoveries from the retail sector alongside expansion of the tax net, financial devolution, and greater contribution from provinces for national security. The engagements are likely to continue virtually until the announcement of the federal and provincial budgets and their passage by parliament to ensure no lapses from agreed budgetary propositions. Sources said Pakistan has proposed modest relief measures in the upcoming budget, including a slight reduction in super tax, incentives for the real estate sector and relief for the salaried class. However, the IMF has yet to reach a conclusion and is still examining the viability of such measures in the context of revenue target and expenditures and possible recoveries from litigation cases. During the meeting, also attended by ministers for finance, planning, and economic affairs, besides the finance secretary and the FBR chairman, the discussions focused on the implementation and progress of the ongoing IMF loan programme. Both sides expressed satisfaction over the economic reforms undertaken by the government and their accruing positive outcomes, the official statement said. The IMF delegation acknowledged the progress made under the reform agenda and assured the prime minister of continued support from the Fund in the country’s efforts for economic stability and inclusive growth, the statement added. PM meets WB team Separately, the prime minister also met a World Bank delegation led by Managing Director of Operations Anna Bjerde on Thursday and assured her of the steadfast implementation of the economic reform programme necessary to build a solid and sustainable growth. He told the delegation that the government was taking practical steps to achieve maximum benefits from the World Bank’s development investment. He hoped that the World Bank’s Country Partnership Framework would bring more than $20bn in development investment to Pakistan and appreciated the World Bank’s assistance to the victims of the 2022 floods in Pakistan that had impacted millions of people, destroying livelihoods and properties. Ms Bjerde said that the World Bank valued its historic partnership with the government of Pakistan for the development and prosperity of its people. She also expressed gratitude to Prime Minister Shehbaz for his effective role in strengthening the partnership and implementing the Country Partnership Programme. Also appreciating Pakistan’s recent exemplary economic performance and stability, she said that through its positive actions for macroeconomic stability, Pakistan had achieved the impossible and the bank looked forward to continued cooperation to achieve the positive outcomes of the Country Partnership Framework and uplift the Pakistani people for which policy continuity for sustainable and inclusive growth was necessary. Published in Dawn, May 23rd, 2025

data.title: Pakistan suffered 7th highest number of casualties from explosives in 2024: report
data.description: ISLAMABAD: Pakistan was the seventh most affected country for civilians harmed by explosive weapons in 2024, with 790 civilian casualties and 210 killings, recorded across 248 incidents in the country, according to a report released by UK-based NGO, Action on Armed Violence (AOAV) on Thursday. Titled, ‘Action on Armed Violence’ (AOAV), the report notes that the casualties in 2024 represent a nine per cent decrease from 2023.  However, there was a 11 per cent increase in incidents compared to 218 in 2023. Pakistan was listed at seventh position among the 15 most affected countries and territories in 2024. The majority of civilians harmed was attributed to non-state actors, who were reported responsible for 76pc of civilian casualties.  In particular, the Balochistan Liberation Army (BLA) killed and injured 119 civilians in Pakistan last year. The BLA is among the biggest non-state users of explosive weapons in 2024, and it was the reported perpetrator of 15pc civilian casualties, marking a 440pc increase from 22 incidents recorded in 2023. Unknown non-state actors accounted for 54pc of civilian casualties (423), down from 541 recorded civilian casualties in 2023. All suicide bombings in the country were carried out by non-state actors, most notably, of the known non-state actors, were the Balochistan Liberation Army (BLA), who were responsible for 2pc of all 9 incidents, but 89pc (92) of civilian casualties resulting from suicide bombings. Unknown non-state actors accounted for 6pc (5) of incidents, and 11pc of civilian casualties. Overall, 2024 saw the highest number of recorded incidents in Pakistan since 2014, and the second highest number of civilian casualties since 2018, and the second highest number of armed actor casualties since 2015. Published in Dawn, May 23rd, 2025

data.title: NA okays another IMF-dictated law ahead of budget
data.description: • Lawmakers pass the bill without debate • House passes resolution urging govt to condemn India for suspending Indus Waters Treaty ISLAMABAD: Days before presentation of the federal budget for the next fiscal year, the National Assembly on Thursday passed an IMF-dictated money bill through a supplementary agenda and without any debate. The Off the Grid (Captive Power Plants) Levy Bill, 2025, aimed at providing legal justification for the grid levy imposed on the supply of natural gas or imported liquefied natural gas to industrial captive power plants (CPPs) as of March 7, was tabled by Minister for Petroleum Division Ali Pervaiz after the house suspended the rules. The minister moved the motion for the passage of the bill soon after presentation of the report of the standing committee on petroleum by its chairman Mustafa Mehmood. The bill cleared all the required stages in just one day as the committee had also approved it in a meeting held minutes before start of the NA session. The opposition challenged the ruling of the chair on the motion allowing the minister to present the bill for passage, but faced a 99-44 vote defeat after the headcount. Earlier on May 17, the NA had passed the Income Tax (Amendment) Bill 2024. According to an official handout, during the meeting of the NA Standing Committee on Petroleum on Thursday morning, the petroleum minister gave a detailed briefing on the bill, highlighting its significance as part of Pakistan’s commitments under the International Monetary Fund’s Extended Fund Facility. He noted that while the phase-out of captive power generation had long been under consideration, its implementation had been delayed due to prolonged political and economic constraints. The minister emphasised that transitioning industries from captive power systems to the national grid was intended to optimise surplus electricity generation, improve efficiency in the power sector, and relieve financial pressures on the economy. The minister informed the committee that a comprehensive consultation process had been completed in drafting the bill and acknowledged the instrumental role played by the NA speaker in facilitating this process. He assured the committee that the bill was aimed at serving public interest without disrupting industrial operations and that protections for the industrial sector had been incorporated. He also highlighted high electricity prices as a major concern and underscored the need to fulfill public demand through grid supply. It may be recalled that the government had already enforced the law through an ordinance and in March it had notified an increase in gas rates for industrial CPPs by about 23pc and scale down temptation for a substantial cut in power rates to get the policy negotiations going with the IMF in March this year. Since the ordinance was about to complete its constitutional life, it was necessary for the government to get its approval from the National Assembly. Since it was a money bill, it was not required to be passed by the Senate. However, the Senate committee on finance, which was only required to give recommendations to the NA, approved it without making any recommendations on May 16. Resolution Besides this, the National Assembly also passed a unanimous resolution calling on the government to strongly condemn India’s unilateral decision to suspend the Indus Waters Treaty (IWT), terming it a clear violation of the agreement and an “act of war.” The resolution was presented by Minister for Water Resources Mueen Wattoo after a brief debate on the matter before the chair, Abdul Qadir Patel of the PPP, read out prorogation order of the president, thus announcing the end of the summer session which had begun on May 5. In their speeches, the lawmakers criticised Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi for suspending the treaty and accused him of acting with a hostile mindset. The lawmakers also condemned the school bus attack in Khuzdar, blaming India for supporting the attackers. Earlier, the proceedings of the assembly remained suspended for few minutes during the Question Hour when PTI Iqbal Afridi pointed out lack of quorum. Published in Dawn, May 23rd, 2025

data.title: PIA to launch Lahore-Paris flight on June 18
data.description: RAWALPINDI: Pakis­tan International Airlines (PIA) announced on Thursday the launch of direct flights from Lahore to Paris, with the first flight scheduled to take off on June 18, as part of its strategy to further expand flight operations “PIA has decided to operate a weekly flight from Lahore to Paris every Wednesday,” a spokesman for PIA said. “With the launch of this flight, three direct flights per week will become part of PIA’s operations.” The new route is part of the airline’s broader strategy to extend its network to Europe and meet growing demand from the Pakistani diaspora in France and Pakistan, the spokesman said. “This direct route to Paris addresses a long-standing demand from the Pakistani community, offering affordable fares and time savings,” the spokesman added. Earlier this year, to mark the relaunch of PIA flights from Islamabad to Paris, the airline decorated a Boeing 777 aircraft with a model of the Eiffel Tower on its tail and the slogan “I Love Paris” on the nose. The aircraft was modified to meet European Union aviation standards. PIA had also previously introduced a wireless in-flight entertainment system on the Islamabad-Paris route, allowing passengers to access entertainment on their personal devices. Published in Dawn, May 23rd, 2025

data.title: New normal?
data.description: WHY can’t the PTI and its jailed leader decide what they want? Even while leverage is slipping from its hands, the party remains in two minds about whether it ought to negotiate a way out or continue on its path of ‘resistance’. It believes that “it is in Pakistan’s interest” for the state to engage with the PTI, but has never really explained what it is willing to concede in return. It is also quite unjustified to demand that politics be reduced to a zero-sum game between PTI on one side and all other parties on the other. To top it off, Imran Khan continues to maintain a frustrating ambiguity about his position on negotiations, even with the establishment. His remarks to confidantes, which often make their way to social media, seem to consistently undermine the work his own party leaders have been doing to start a dialogue. This chaotic approach has taken a toll on the party. Over time, the urgency for a negotiated settlement has gradually subsided, and the ruling regime has used its position to manufacture various new means of ensuring its continuity in power. Meanwhile, the PTI has been able to make little headway towards its goals. At some point, the party should have reconsidered whether its approach was the right one. While the government may be unpopular with the public, and its legitimacy may continue to remain in doubt, its legislative measures have now ensured that it would be difficult to dislodge it. Indeed, the country has paid, and continues to pay, a steep price for maintaining the status quo, and it is in the nation’s long-term interest that a political ceasefire is reached soon. Things must return to normal. Unfortunately, the appetite for ‘normalcy’ appears to be running out, and the ‘power is power’ doctrine has been gaining in force. But while it is still by and large the PTI that is on the losing end today, the backward slide does not bode well for Pakistani democracy in general. In the absence of defined rules of the game, the political class remains at the mercy of non-political forces and their agendas. It is better for the different parties to work out a modus vivendi based on fair principles and mutual respect than to resign themselves to playing second fiddle in policymaking and governance. Published in Dawn, May 23rd, 2025

data.title: PTI felicitates Gen Munir on field marshal title, says he has ‘more responsibility’ now
data.description: PTI Chairman Gohar Ali Khan has felicitated Chief of Army Staff General Asim Munir for his elevation to the rank of field marshal, saying that he now had more responsibility to “make the situation better”. Earlier this week, the government promoted Gen Munir to the rank of field marshal in recognition of his “strategic leadership and decisive role” in defeating India during the military confrontation between the two countries that ended with a US-mediated ceasefire . Field marshal is the highest rank in armies modelled after the British Army. In Pakistan, it was awarded only once before, to General Mohammad Ayub Khan in 1959. Speaking to reporters outside Rawalpindi’s Adiala Jail yesterday after meeting with incarcerated ex-premier Imran Khan, Gohar said: “A long time has passed. The PTI is a major party, Khan sahib is the most popular leader. We want these difficulties to end now. “This is why I am saying that the [army chief] has gotten this new honour of field marshal. [We] have congratulated but after this new honour, there is an increased responsibility on him to play his role even more and make the situation better.” View this post on Instagram Responding to a question, Gohar said that the PTI would issue a formal stance on the development. He added, “We have no strife with the military. Khan sahib also said yesterday that we stand with our armed forces and whoever is related to the armed forces will be uncontroversial.” “Contacts have not been restored for now, but it is definitely our desire. Khan sahib has said that we never closed the door for talks with the establishment,” Gohar further said. Gohar’s comments echoed those stated in a post on Imran’s X account, wherein the ex-PM said he was willing to speak to those who have power, in the best interest of the country. Asked specifically about alleged intervention in politics, Gohar said, “We all say that the military should have no role in politics, […] and I say that whatever happens should be above politics. “After all, it is a major institution. It has had an influence and remains, so I will request that whoever can play their role in making the situation better to do so,” the PTI leader added. The elevation, first cleared by the federal cabinet and later communicated by Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif to President Asif Ali Zardari, marks the first such promotion in over six decades. The government also announced a second, open-ended extension in the tenure of Air Chief Marshal Zaheer Ahmed Babar Sidhu, making him the first Pakistan Air Force head to receive two extensions. Gohar also spoke about India, saying that “an air of war was still lingering”. He termed that the Pakistani forces had secured an “amazing victory, which India could not have even imagined”. “In my opinion, this war was even more serious than the 1965 or 1971 wars, because both countries are now nuclear powers,” he highlighted. However, he cautioned the nation to remain united and alert against India’s “another such attempt and nefarious intentions”. Implications for military hierarchy A Ministry of Defence notification said that Gen Munir’s promotion to field marshal had been made under Rule 199A of the Army Regulations (Rules) 1998. The rules are classified, but according to a military source, the mentioned rule reads: “199-A. Promotion to field marshal. A general officer, whether serving or retired, may be promoted to the rank of field marshal by the federal government without regard to seniority or any specific appointment.” However, experts noted the silence of the Constitution and the Pakistan Army Act on such an appointment. While the rank does not grant additional operational authority, its conferral during a period of heightened regional tension carries strategic and political symbolism. It may also bolster Field Marshal Munir’s standing both within the military and in political circles, particularly amid ongoing internal instability and civil-military friction. Senator Mushahid Hussain Syed, who previously headed the Senate defence committee, noted: “Field Marshal Asim Munir is now very much in the driving seat as the pivot of the power structure, more so, given the weakness and divisions amongst the civilian politicians. Even before May, which has become an inflection point for Pakistan, for India and for South Asia, all the mainstream political forces were convinced that the road to Islamabad lies through Rawalpindi.” COAS Munir’s promotion is not expected to alter operational command but serves as a symbolic acknowledgement of his wartime leadership. The global precedent supports this view. In India, Field Marshals Sam Manekshaw (1973) and K.M. Cariappa (1986) were promoted purely for ceremonial reasons, with no changes to the army’s structure. Similarly, in the United Kingdom and the United States, five-star titles have historically honoured extraordinary service during major wars without altering command frameworks.
data.translatedTitle: PTI felicitates Gen Munir on field marshal title, says he has ‘more responsibility’ now
data.translatedDescription: PTI Chairman Gohar Ali Khan has felicitated Chief of Army Staff General Asim Munir for his elevation to the rank of field marshal, saying that he now had more responsibility to “make the situation better”. Earlier this week, the government promoted Gen Munir to the rank of field marshal in recognition of his “strategic leadership and decisive role” in defeating India during the military confrontation between the two countries that ended with a US-mediated ceasefire . Field marshal is the highest rank in armies modelled after the British Army. In Pakistan, it was awarded only once before, to General Mohammad Ayub Khan in 1959. Speaking to reporters outside Rawalpindi’s Adiala Jail yesterday after meeting with incarcerated ex-premier Imran Khan, Gohar said: “A long time has passed. The PTI is a major party, Khan sahib is the most popular leader. We want these difficulties to end now. “This is why I am saying that the [army chief] has gotten this new honour of field marshal. [We] have congratulated but after this new honour, there is an increased responsibility on him to play his role even more and make the situation better.” View this post on Instagram Responding to a question, Gohar said that the PTI would issue a formal stance on the development. He added, “We have no strife with the military. Khan sahib also said yesterday that we stand with our armed forces and whoever is related to the armed forces will be uncontroversial.” “Contacts have not been restored for now, but it is definitely our desire. Khan sahib has said that we never closed the door for talks with the establishment,” Gohar further said. Gohar’s comments echoed those stated in a post on Imran’s X account, wherein the ex-PM said he was willing to speak to those who have power, in the best interest of the country. Asked specifically about alleged intervention in politics, Gohar said, “We all say that the military should have no role in politics, […] and I say that whatever happens should be above politics. “After all, it is a major institution. It has had an influence and remains, so I will request that whoever can play their role in making the situation better to do so,” the PTI leader added. The elevation, first cleared by the federal cabinet and later communicated by Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif to President Asif Ali Zardari, marks the first such promotion in over six decades. The government also announced a second, open-ended extension in the tenure of Air Chief Marshal Zaheer Ahmed Babar Sidhu, making him the first Pakistan Air Force head to receive two extensions. Gohar also spoke about India, saying that “an air of war was still lingering”. He termed that the Pakistani forces had secured an “amazing victory, which India could not have even imagined”. “In my opinion, this war was even more serious than the 1965 or 1971 wars, because both countries are now nuclear powers,” he highlighted. However, he cautioned the nation to remain united and alert against India’s “another such attempt and nefarious intentions”. Implications for military hierarchy A Ministry of Defence notification said that Gen Munir’s promotion to field marshal had been made under Rule 199A of the Army Regulations (Rules) 1998. The rules are classified, but according to a military source, the mentioned rule reads: “199-A. Promotion to field marshal. A general officer, whether serving or retired, may be promoted to the rank of field marshal by the federal government without regard to seniority or any specific appointment.” However, experts noted the silence of the Constitution and the Pakistan Army Act on such an appointment. While the rank does not grant additional operational authority, its conferral during a period of heightened regional tension carries strategic and political symbolism. It may also bolster Field Marshal Munir’s standing both within the military and in political circles, particularly amid ongoing internal instability and civil-military friction. Senator Mushahid Hussain Syed, who previously headed the Senate defence committee, noted: “Field Marshal Asim Munir is now very much in the driving seat as the pivot of the power structure, more so, given the weakness and divisions amongst the civilian politicians. Even before May, which has become an inflection point for Pakistan, for India and for South Asia, all the mainstream political forces were convinced that the road to Islamabad lies through Rawalpindi.” COAS Munir’s promotion is not expected to alter operational command but serves as a symbolic acknowledgement of his wartime leadership. The global precedent supports this view. In India, Field Marshals Sam Manekshaw (1973) and K.M. Cariappa (1986) were promoted purely for ceremonial reasons, with no changes to the army’s structure. Similarly, in the United Kingdom and the United States, five-star titles have historically honoured extraordinary service during major wars without altering command frameworks.

data.title: Dokument: Planerna kring Centralstationen har ”ohanterbar katastrofpotential”
data.description: Jätteprojektet Centralstaden – området kring Centralstationen i Stockholm – utlovas bli en ”ny entré till huvudstaden”. Nu kan DN avslöja interna dokument som larmar om stora risker, om planerna blir verklighet. ”Det innebär en riskbild som inte har hanterats i modern svensk samhällsplanering tidigare”, lyder analysen i ett internt PM från Länsstyrelsen.
data.translatedTitle: Documents: The plans around Central Station have "unmanageable disaster potential"
data.translatedDescription: The giant project Centralstaden - the area around the Central Station in Stockholm - is promised to be a "new entrance to the capital". Now DN can reveal internal documents that alert great risks, if the plans become reality. "This means a risk picture that has not been handled in modern Swedish community planning before," says the analysis in an internal PM from the county administrative board.

data.title: Andreas Johansson Heinö: Trump har gjort Springsteen till ännu en musiker med fånigt plakat i handen
data.description: Det är redan ett av de mer citatvänliga slagen i det destruktiva kulturkriget: Donald Trump kallade Bruce Springsteen för ett torkat katrinplommon som ska hålla käften. Bruce Springsteen själv gick mycket längre. KOLUMNEN. Andreas Johansson Heinö är doktor i statsvetenskap, förläggare vid Timbro förlag och fristående kolumnist i Dagens Nyheter.

data.translatedDescription: It is already one of the more quotation -friendly beats in the destructive cultural war: Donald Trump called Bruce Springsteen a dried prunes to shut up. Bruce Springsteen himself went much further. The column. Andreas Johansson Heinö is a doctor of political science, publisher at Timbro publisher and independent columnist in Dagens Nyheter.

data.title: Koniec Airbnb, jakie znamy? Platforma będzie teraz naśladować Booking.com
data.description: Airbnb, internetowa platforma z noclegami, wyrosła na pomyśle dzielenia się przez właścicieli mieszkań i domów  wolnymi pokojami (economy sharnig) z turystami. Szczytna idea zamieniła się z czasem w potężny biznes pośredniczenia w wynajmowaniu całych domów i mieszkań. Teraz firma doszła do wniosku, że i to za mało.
data.translatedTitle: End of Airbnb, what do we know? The platform will now imitate booking.com
data.translatedDescription: Airbnb, an online platform with accommodation, grew up the idea of ​​sharing apartments and houses with free rooms with tourists. The Szczytna Idea turned into a powerful brokering business in renting entire houses and apartments over time. Now the company has come to the conclusion that this is not enough.

data.title: Ile osób wyjedzie z Polski, gdy wybuchnie wojna? Wojsko musi stać się atrakcyjne

data.translatedTitle: How many people will leave Poland when the war breaks out? The army must become attractive
data.translatedDescription: Let's treat the symbols like a gadget around which we unite. Above all, however, let's build civic activity. Because the Russians think we will run out of will to fight. Well, but how do you make the service in the Polish army attractive to the Z generation?

data.translatedTitle: Major Katarzyna Szal: You don't mean anything in the army. Women are needed in the army

In fact, however, he has powerful indirect tools that can bring the economy benefits, but also losses.

data.title: Wzrost poziomu mórz zmusi miliony ludzi do ucieczki? Nowe prognozy ekspertów
data.description: Utrzymanie globalnego wzrostu temperatury na poziomie 1,5 stopnia Celsjusza nie zatrzyma topnienia pokrywy lodowej – twierdzą naukowcy i powołują się na nowe badania. Ostrzegają też, że z tego powodu miliony ludzi na całym świecie mogą zostać zmuszone do opuszczenia swoich domów.
data.translatedTitle: The increase in seas will force millions of people to escape? New expert forecasts
data.translatedDescription: Maintaining a global temperature increase of 1.5 degrees Celsius will not stop the melting of the ice cover - scientists say and cite new research. They also warn that for this reason millions of people around the world can be forced to leave their homes.

data.title: Antyczny zabytek ożyje po tysiącu lat. To projekt słynnego architekta

data.translatedTitle: The ancient monument will come alive after a thousand years. This is a design of the famous architect
data.translatedDescription: The architectural studio of David Chipperfield, British architect awarded with the prestigious Pritzker award, prepared a project to rebuild the ancient amphitheater in the Italian city of Brescia. "We want to connect the past with the everyday life of the city," says Chipperfield.

data.title: Jak zabito ludzi „Bartka”?
data.description: We wrześniu 1946 r. ubecy przeprowadzili operację specjalną „Lawina”, której celem była fizyczna likwidacja członków zgrupowania Narodowych Sił Zbrojnych z terenu Podbeskidzia. IPN odtworzył mechanizm zbrodni UB na żołnierzach z oddziału NSZ Henryka „Bartka” Flamego.
data.translatedTitle: How was the "Bartek" people killed?
data.translatedDescription: In September 1946, the UBEcy performed a special operation "avalanche", which aimed to physically liquidate the members of the National Armed Forces grouping from the Podbeskidzia area. The Institute of National Remembrance recreated the UB crime mechanism on soldiers from the NSZ branch Henryk "Bartek" Flame.

data.title: Havárie letadla v mlze. Na řadě domů a aut způsobilo v kalifornském San Diegu spoušť
data.description: Na palubě malého letadla Cessna 550, které v mlze havarovalo v kalifornském San Diegu, zemřeli tři lidé. Novinářům to řekl Dan Eddy z místního hasičského sboru s tím, že na zemi nebyl při nehodě nikdo zraněn. Vyšetřovatelé se snaží objasnit, zda letadlo narazilo do nadzemního elektrického vedení, píše agentura AP.
data.translatedTitle: An aircraft crash in the fog. On a number of houses and cars caused in San Diego, California
data.translatedDescription: Three people died on board the small Cessna 550 aircraft, which crashed in the fog in San Diego, California. Dan Eddy from the local fire brigade told reporters, saying that no one was injured on the ground. Investigators are trying to clarify whether the aircraft hit the above -ground power line, writes AP.

data.title: Ataque israelita deixa mais de 50 desaparecidos na Faixa de Gaza
data.description: Um bombardeamento israelita destruiu nas últimas horas uma casa no campo de refugiados de Jabalia, na Faixa de Gaza, de acordo com a Proteção Civil, que estima que mais de 50 pessoas continuem desaparecidas sob os escombros.
data.translatedTitle: Israelite attack leaves more than 50 missing in the Gaza Strip
data.translatedDescription: Israelite bombardment has destroyed a home in the Jabalia Refugee Field in the last hours in the Gaza Strip, according to Civil Protection, which estimates that more than 50 people remain missing under the rubble.

data.title: Sindicatos protestam contra decreto que limita direito à greve na Argentina
data.description: Os sindicatos da Argentina protestaram na quinta-feira contra um decreto do presidente ultraliberal, Javier Milei, que limita o direito à greve, ao exigir um nível elevado de serviços mínimos em mais setores.
data.translatedTitle: Unions protest a decree that limits strike in Argentina
data.translatedDescription: Argentina unions protested on Thursday against a decree of Ultraliberal President Javier Milei, which limits the right to strike by requiring a high level of minimum services in more sectors.

data.title: Filipinas apoiam adesão plena de Timor-Leste à ASEAN
data.description: As Filipinas manifestaram oficialmente apoio à adesão plena de Timor-Leste à Associação das Nações do Sudeste Asiático (ASEAN), num comunicado à imprensa divulgado na página do presidente filipino, Ferdinand Marcos Jr.
data.translatedTitle: Philippines support Full adhesion of Timor-Leste to Asean
data.translatedDescription: The Philippines officially expressed support for the full adhesion of Timor-Leste to the Association of Southeast Asia Nations (ASEAN), in a statement to the press released on President Filipino's page, Ferdinand Marcos Jr.

data.title: São Tomé e Príncipe enaltece promessa do Brasil em apoiar agropecuário africano
data.description: O ministro da Agricultura, Desenvolvimento Rural e Pescas de São Tomé e Príncipe enalteceu o compromisso assumido pelo presidente do Brasil em apoiar o crescimento agropecuário através da transferência de conhecimento e tecnologia.
data.translatedTitle: Sao Tome and Principe praises Brazil's promise to support African agriculture
data.translatedDescription: The Minister of Agriculture, Rural Development and Fisheries of Sao Tome and Principe praised the commitment made by the President of Brazil to support agricultural growth through the transfer of knowledge and technology.

data.title: Produtora de bananas no Panamá despede milhares de trabalhadores em greve
data.description: A produtora de bananas Chiquita Panamá anunciou que vai despedir os trabalhadores em greve desde 28 de abril na província costeira Bocas del Toro, após dias de diálogo entre o governo e o sindicato.
data.translatedTitle: Bananas producer in Panama dismiss thousands of strike workers
data.translatedDescription: Bananas producer Chiquita Panama has announced that it will dismiss strike workers since April 28 in the coastal province Bocas del Toro, after days of dialogue between the government and the union.

data.title: Frente Cívica pede a Luís Montenegro que cobre indemnizações à REN
data.description: A associação Frente Cívica disse nas últimas horas ter pedido ao primeiro-ministro, Luís Montenegro, que o Governo cobre uma indemnização à REN - Redes Energéticas Nacionais pelos prejuízos causados pelo apagão de 28 de abril.
data.translatedTitle: Civic Front asks Luís Montenegro to cover compensation to Ren
data.translatedDescription: The Civic Front Association said in recent hours it was asked the Prime Minister, Luís Montenegro, that the government covers compensation to REN - National Energy Networks for the damage caused by the April 28 blackout.

data.title: Ataques de drones ucranianos paralisam aeroportos de Moscovo
data.description: O tráfego aéreo em redor de Moscovo foi suspenso na quinta-feira, devido a ataques de drones ucranianos, revelou o Ministério da Defesa russo, acrescentando que intercetou cerca de 100 drones, 35 destes quando se aproximavam da capital.
data.translatedTitle: Ukrainian drone attacks paralyze Moscow airports
data.translatedDescription: Air traffic in Moscow was suspended on Thursday due to attacks on Ukrainian drones, the Russian Ministry of Defense revealed, adding that it intercepted about 100 drones, 35 of these as they approached the capital.

data.title: Saudi Arabia’s annual inflation rate holds steady at 2.3% in April: GASTAT
data.description:
RIYADH: Rent increases and fuel price rises helped Saudi Arabia post an inflation rate of 2.3 percent in April — the same level as a year earlier — official data showed.

	According to the latest figures from the General Authority for Statistics, a 6.8 percent increase in the cost of housing, water, electricity, gas, and other fuels contributed to the rise.

	Within this category, rents paid for housing rose by 8.1 percent, driven by an 11.9 percent spike in apartment rental prices, a category that holds significant weight in the overall index.
data.translatedTitle: Saudi Arabia’s annual inflation rate holds steady at 2.3% in April: GASTAT
data.translatedDescription:

	Within this category, rents paid for housing rose by 8.1 percent, driven by an 11.9 percent spike in apartment rental prices, a category that holds significant weight in the overall index.

data.title: Haaland eyes FA Cup to save face after Man City’s ‘horrific’ season
data.description:
MANCHESTER: Erling Haaland said Manchester City must deliver in the FA Cup final on Saturday to salvage something from a “horrific” season that saw them deposed as English champions for the first time in five years.
	City face Crystal Palace at Wembley aiming to avoid a first trophyless campaign since Pep Guardiola’s debut season in charge in 2016/17.
	Guardiola’s men sit fourth in the Premier League, 18 points adrift of champions Liverpool, and in a battle just to secure a top-five finish and Champions League football next season in their final two league matches.
data.translatedTitle: Haaland eyes FA Cup to save face after Man City’s ‘horrific’ season

data.title: Ben Sulayem drives major improvements to FIA’s international Sporting Code
data.description: DUBAI: The Federation Internationale de l’Automobile, the global governing body for motor sport and the federation for mobility organizations worldwide, has announced that it is to make major improvements to Appendix B of its International Sporting Code following an extensive review commissioned by FIA’s President Mohammed Ben Sulayem.

data.title: Russian delegation arrives in Turkiye for Ukraine war talks
data.description:
ISTANBUL: Russia’s delegation arrived in Istanbul for peace talks with Ukraine, Russian Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Maria Zakharova said Thursday, and a Ukrainian official said a delegation including President Volodymyr Zelensky was on its way the the Turkish capital Ankara.
	Russian President Vladimir Putin was not part of the delegation from Moscow, however, according to a list released by the Kremlin Wednesday night, prompting criticism from Western officials that the Kremlin isn’t serious about the peace effort.

data.title: Lufthansa group suspends Tel Aviv flights following Houthi attacks on Israel
data.description:
BERLIN: Airline group Lufthansa will suspend its flights to Tel Aviv through May 25, it said on Thursday, citing the “current situation.”
	This affects flights operated by Lufthansa, Swiss, Austrian Airlines, Eurowings, ITA Airways, Brussels Airlines and Lufthansa Cargo, it added.
	Global airlines have again halted their flights to and from Tel Aviv after a missile fired by Yemen’s Houthis toward Israel on May 4 landed near the country’s main international airport in Tel Aviv.

data.title: Al-Ain to host 6th IMMAF Youth World Championships in July
data.description:
ABU DHABI: The UAE Jiu-Jitsu and Mixed Martial Arts Federation has announced that the sixth IMMAF Youth World Championships will be held in Al-Ain Region for the first time from July 21-27.

	The tournament will be staged at the Al-Ain Convention Center with more than 1,000 male and female athletes from 60 countries competing in the championship’s largest event to date.

data.title: India says Pakistan nuclear arsenal should be under UN surveillance
data.description:
SRINAGAR: Pakistan’s nuclear arsenal should be brought under the surveillance of the UN’s nuclear agency, Indian Defense Minister Rajnath Singh said Thursday, following last week’s conflict between Islamabad and New Delhi.

	“I wanted to raise this question for the world: are nuclear weapons safe in the hands of a rogue and irresponsible nation?” Singh told troops at a base in Srinagar in Indian-administered Kashmir.
data.translatedTitle: India says Pakistan nuclear arsenal should be under UN surveillance

data.title: Madinah municipality continues intensive food safety inspections
data.description:
MADINAH: Food safety inspections have been stepped up ahead of the arrival of Hajj pilgrims, reported the Saudi Press Agency on Thursday.

	The Madinah Regional Municipality has carried out routine testing of commercial establishments, with 4,165 samples to date confirmed as conforming to approved standards. So far, 186 samples have been deemed unfit for human consumption.
data.translatedTitle: Madinah municipality continues intensive food safety inspections

data.title: Trump: India has offered US a trade deal with zero tariffs
data.description:
RIYADH: US President Donald Trump said on Thursday in Doha that India had offered the US a trade deal with zero tariffs.

	New Delhi is seeking to clinch a trade deal with the US within the 90-day pause on tariff hikes announced by Trump on April 9 for major trading partners, which had included a 26 percent tariff on India.

	“It is very hard to sell in India, and they are offering us a deal where basically they are willing to literally charge us no tariffs,” Trump said in a meeting with executives in Doha.
data.translatedTitle: Trump: India has offered US a trade deal with zero tariffs

data.title: Jordan evacuates second group of cancer patients from Gaza
data.description:
AMMAN: Jordan’s government on Wednesday began evacuating four child cancer patients and 12 family members from Gaza.

	They are the second group of patients evacuated for treatment under the Jordan Medical Corridor initiative, started in March this year, that aims to treat 2,000 Gazan children.

	The children and their families were evacuated by the Royal Jordanian Air Force in cooperation with the World Health Organization and the Ministry of Health.

	They will be treated at the King Hussein Cancer Center.

data.title: Colombia cierra temporalmente su frontera con Venezuela por elecciones regionales

data.translatedTitle: Colombia temporarily closes its border with Venezuela for regional elections
data.translatedDescription: The Colombian government announced on Thursday the temporary closure of its border with Venezuela between Friday and Monday for the regional and parliamentary elections next Sunday. «As of Friday, May 23 at 12:01 a.m. (05.01 GMT) and until Monday, May 26 at 11:59 p.m. (04.59 GMT […] Colombia entry temporarily closes its border with Venezuela for regional elections was first published in El Nacional.

data.title: Trump intenta eliminar el Acuerdo Flores, que protege a menores migrantes en custodia federal
data.description: El gobierno del presidente Donald Trump está intentando deshacer un acuerdo judicial que ha estado vigente por más de 25 años, el cual garantiza la protección esencial de migrantes menores de edad bajo custodia federal. data.title: Haïti-RD-Migration : La République Dominicaine viole ses engagements internationaux, selon un collectif français de solidarité
data.description: Dans une lettre ouverte en date du 16 mai 2025, adressée au ministre français des affaires étrangères , le Collectif Haïti de France s'élève contre les violences et les politiques« discriminatoires » et « d'épuration ethnique » du gouvernement de la République Dominicaine envers les migrantes et migrants haïtien-ne-s, et les Dominicaines et Dominicains noir-e-s. - Documents
data.translatedTitle: Haiti-RD-Migration: The Dominican Republic violates its international commitments, according to a French solidarity collective

data.title: Albert Ramdin prend les rênes de l'Oea avec Haïti comme priorité brûlante

data.title: Haïti : Didier Dominique, l'engagement militant d'un intellectuel au service des travailleurs
data.description: Didier Dominique, figure majeure du syndicalisme haïtien, est décédé le 18 mai 2025. Intellectuel engagé et militant infatigable, il laisse un héritage puissant dans la lutte ouvrière, la défense des droits humains et la pensée critique, témoigne Yannick Étienne dans un hommage sur AlterPresse. - Perspectives
data.translatedTitle: Haiti: Didier Dominique, the militant commitment of an intellectual in the service of workers
data.translatedDescription: Didier Dominique, a major figure in Haitian unionism, died on May 18, 2025. Intelligence committed and tireless militant, he leaves a powerful legacy in the workers' struggle, the defense of human rights and critical thinking, testifies Yannick Étienne in a tribute to Alterpresse. - Perspectives

As we have a dog world for the rest of the time, most of the activities and fun activities are planned for the three summer months.

data.title: MARI-LIIS TIMMOTALO ⟩ Toksiline maskuliinsus rikub suhteid ja vaimset tervist
data.description: Sotsiaalmeedias levib noorte seas kuvand mehelikkusest, mis seostab mehe väärtust suurte musklite, emotsioonide varjamise ja naiste üle domineerimise kaudu. Sellise mõtteviisi levik ei ohusta ainult naiste õigusi, vaid jätab sügava jälje ka noormeeste vaimsele tervisele, kirjutab Mari-Liis Timmotalo, Tartu Ülikooli ajakirjanduse ja kommunikatsiooni magistrant.
data.translatedTitle: Mari-Liis Timmotalo⟩ toxic masculinity violates relationships and mental health
data.translatedDescription: In social media, there is an image of masculinity among young people, associating a man's value through hiding great muscles, emotions and dominating women. The spread of this way of thinking is not only a threat to women's rights, but also leaves a deep mark on the mental health of the young men, writes Mari-Liis Timmotalo, a Master of Journalism and Communications at the University of Tartu.

data.title: Sinoptikai atskleidė, kada pasitrauks lietaus debesys ir sulauksime šiltesnių orų
data.description: Šiandien rytas išauš apniukęs, pragiedrulių bus tik kai kur vakariniuose rajonuose. Įdienojus tankiausi debesys atsitraukinės į rytus, pragiedrulių daugės. Apniukęs dangus iki pat vakaro išliks tik rytiniuose rajonuose. Lietaus vis dar bus daugelyje vietovių, tačiau ilgiausiai jis tęsis rytiniuose rajonuose, o iš kitų regionų pasitrauks dar primoje dienos pusėje. Pūs nestiprus vakarinių krypčių vėjas. Aukščiausia temperatūra šiandien pasiskirstys tarp 12–17 laipsnių šilumos.
data.translatedTitle: Synoptics revealed when the rain clouds will come out and we will get warmer weather
data.translatedDescription: Today, the morning will dawn, and there will be only some in the western areas. As the sun's dense clouds will retreat to the east, the clouds will increase. Until the sky, until evening, it will only remain in the eastern areas. There will still be rain in many areas, but it will last for the longest time in the eastern areas and will withdraw from other regions in the primary side of the day. Little winds of the western directions. The highest temperature today will be distributed between 12-17 degrees Celsius.

data.title: В Узбекистане создадут Международный хаб по детскому раку
data.description: В Узбекистане создадут Международный академический хаб по детскому раку, который будет действовать в форме государственного учреждения при Научно-практическом медицинском Центре детской онкологии, гематологии и иммунологии. Об этом говорится в постановлении президента РУз Шавката Мирзиёева, размещенном на портале нормативно-правовых актов Lex.uz,  передает «Фергана» .
data.translatedTitle: In Uzbekistan, an international hub in children's cancer will be created
data.translatedDescription: In Uzbekistan, an international academic hub in children's cancer will be created, which will act in the form of a state institution at the scientific and practical medical center of children's oncology, hematology and immunology. This is stated in the Decree of the President of the RUZ Shavkat Mirziyoyev, located on the portal of the legal acts of Lex.uz, Ferghana reports.

data.title: В Душанбе состоялся матч легенд футбола Таджикистана и России. Как это было?
data.description: На Центральном республиканском стадионе Душанбе 22 мая прошел товарищеский матч легенд футбола Таджикистана и России, приуроченный к празднованию Всемирного дня футбола, который ежегодно отмечается 25 мая.      Встреча завершилась со счётом 3:1 в пользу российской команды, но результат отошел на второй план – главной стала атмосфера уважения, ностальгии и любви к футболу.
data.translatedTitle: In Dushanbe, a match of the legends of football of Tajikistan and Russia took place. How was it?
data.translatedDescription: On May 22, a friendly match of football of Tajikistan and Russia was held at the Central Republican Republican Stadium Dushanbe, dedicated to celebrating World Football Day, which is annually celebrated on May 25.      The meeting ended with a score of 3: 1 in favor of the Russian team, but the result faded into the background - the main atmosphere of respect, nostalgia and love for football became the main thing.

data.title: Cabral abriu a mão de todo o conforto que tinha na altura (em Lisboa e em Bissau), e decidiu dar sua vida para o seu povo. Lutou para acabar não só com a miséria, mas também para dar educação ao seu povo, um sonho que felizmente brotou e hoje podemos contar com quadros qualificados. Por isso é triste e vergonhoso constatar que alguns desses ditos “quadros qualificados” são gananciosos e outros são bajuladores

data.title: DSP o Maquiavélico Ganancioso
data.description: Guineenses, mais uma vez, venho para vos alertar sobre o perigo que Domingos Simões Pereira representa para a Guiné-Bissau. Faço esse alerta a todos os guineenses sem exceção que se encontre no país ou no estrangeiro, ao PAIGC em especial e na pessoa do Cipriano Cassamá em concreto. Alerta esse sobre o verdadeiro DSP, o verdadeiro espírito que move esse sujeito, o qual alguns ainda continuam a acreditar para não dizer adorar. Domingos Simões Pereira é um manipulador, um verdadeiro chantagista e calculista provavelmente, tipo de comportamento que ultrapassa o nível de psicopata. U m ambicioso desmedido, um verdadeiro criminoso que sabe como e quando cometer o crime. Ele jamais coabitaria não só com JOMAV, assim como com qualquer presidente que seria eleito, a não ser o que ele apoiou disfarçadamente. Isto porque ele tem sua própria agenda, e o PAIGC é simplesmente uma plataforma para sua concretização. DSP jamais coabitaria com JOMAV porque o seu candidato preferido era o Paulo Gomes e sempre será, o qual juntamente com Tchitchi vão delineando mecanismo de modo a serem os novos donos da Guiné-Bissau. Segundo eles este é um processo a médio prazo, e é preciso coragem e paciência para concretiza-lo. Ganhar o congresso não importa em que circunstância e ter novamente o partido na mão, é uma fase concluída em proveito deles, enquanto verdadeiros militantes do PAIGC estão a bater palmas. Depois dessa eleição legislativa, não importa o resultado, o Cipriano Cassama que se prepare a mala ou fica de bico fechado, pois o candidato preferido para o partido será o Paulo Gomes, e esse sim deve ter a voz dentro do partido. DSP é um ambicioso desmedido, nunca teve consideração por ninguém, JOMAV muito menos, o sujeito é um maquiavélico nato, Cipriano Casama será descartado quando menos esperar podes tomar a nota. Guineenses, falar do Paulo Gomes e Tchitchi é falar do MCCI e demais outras organizações e personalidades camufladas no nosso país. Esses dois indivíduos são os principais financiadores do MCCI e demais outras personalidades boca de aluguel na cidade de Bissau. O MCCI, Milícia idealizado por JBV e DSP, agora financiado e dirigido por "futuro triângulo do poder" ou seja, "DSP, Paulo Gomes e Tchitchi", têm 3 principais objectivos: 1º Perturbar a ordem pública em nome da cidadania, difamar e tentar descredibilizar qualquer que seja organizações ou indivíduos não alinhados ao triângulo, de modo a suportar suas caminhadas na busca do poder. 2º Caso se concretize o objectivo do triângulo, o papel da Milícia do MCCI passará a ser de vigilância constante a todos os adversários de modo a garantir falsa paz social e o poder de controlo. 3º Tentar ganhar credibilidade junto das organizações internacionais e regionais, através de suas visitas e actividades de fachada, para quando houver as tais actividades de perturbações de ordem pública, poderem ganhar notoriedade. Mas isso não deve preocupar ninguém, pois estão bem identificados e bem caçados, dentro e fora da Guiné-Bissau. Não tenho nada contra ninguém, mas quem continuar a perturbar verdadeira paz social dos guineenses em troca de benefícios como sempre foi nos últimos anos dessa crise, e que sempre tenho tolerado, então que fique claro "estou firme e determinado para tudo e todos". Para finalizar, gostaria de vos deixar uma reflexão com a seguinte frase: " Domingos Simões Pereira é um perigo grave para o futuro do país ". Isto porque publicar aqui tudo que é necessário para provar ou sustentar a razão dessa frase, só pode agravar ainda mais a paz social que tanto necessitamos. Chega, chega não podemos continuar a viver nessa turbulência vida toda, meus irmãos guineenses, não é saudável, é tóxico, não é justo para um povo que tanto sofreu. António Aly Silva » aaly.silva@gmail.com » aaly_silva@hotmail.com » Tel. (+245) 668 31 13
data.translatedTitle: DSP The greedy Machiavellian
data.translatedDescription: Guineans, once again, come to alert you to the danger that Domingos Simões Pereira represents to Guinea-Bissau. I make this alert to all Guineans without exception that you are in the country or abroad, to the PAIGC in particular and the person of Cyprian Cassamá in concrete. Warns this about the true DSP, the true spirit that moves this subject, which some still continue to believe not to say to worship. Domingos Simões Pereira is a manipulator, a real blackmailer and calculator, probably, kind of behavior that goes beyond the psychopath level. An ambitious excessive, a true criminal who knows how and when to commit the crime. He would never cohabble not only with Jomav, as well as with any president who would be elected, except what he supported undercover. This is because it has its own agenda, and PAIGC is simply a platform for its realization. DSP would never cohabble with Jomav because his favorite candidate was Paulo Gomes and always will be, who together with Tchitchi are outlining mechanism so that they are the new owners of Guinea-Bissau. According to them this is a process in the medium term, and it takes courage and patience to realize it. Winning Congress does not matter under what circumstances and have the party again in hand, it is a phase completed for them, while true PAIGC militants are clapping. After this legislative election, no matter the result, Cipriano Cassama who prepares the suitcase or is closed, because the favorite candidate for the party will be Paulo Gomes, and this must have his voice inside the party. DSP is an ambitious excessive, never considered by anyone, much less Jomav, the subject is a born Machiavellian, Cyprian Casama will be discarded when least expecting you can take the note. Guineans, talking about Paulo Gomes and Tchitchi is talking about MCCI and other other camouflaged organizations and personalities in our country. These two individuals are MCCI's main funders and other other rental mouths in the city of Bissau. The MCCI, a militia designed by JBV and DSP, now funded and directed by "future triangle of power" ie "DSP, Paulo Gomes and Tchitchi", have 3 main objectives: 1st disrupting public order in the name of citizenship, defaming and trying to disbelief whatever organizations or individuals not aligned with the triangle in order to support their walks in the search for power. 2º If the objective of the triangle is realized, the role of the MCCI militia will become constant surveillance to all opponents to ensure false social peace and the power of control. 3º Try to gain credibility with international and regional organizations, through their visits and facade activities, so when there are such public order disturbance activities, they can gain notoriety. But this should not worry anyone, as they are well identified and well hunted, inside and outside Guinea-Bissau. I have nothing against anyone, but those who continue to disturb true social peace of the Guineans in exchange for benefits as always has been in the last years of this crisis, and that I have always tolerated, so that it is clear "I am firm and determined for everything and everyone." Finally, I would like to leave you a reflection with the following sentence: "Domingos Simões Pereira is a serious danger to the country's future." This is because publishing here everything that is necessary to prove or support the reason for this sentence, can only further aggravate the social peace we need so much. Enough, enough we can not continue to live in this turbulence all life, my Guinean brothers, is not healthy, it is toxic, not fair to a people who suffered so much. data.title: APANHA-SE MAIS DEPRESSA UM MENTIROSO QUE UM COXO!
data.description:
DSP através da sua equipa de "Lambe-Botas" está cavando cada vez mais a sua própria cova, adiantando cada vez mais o seu fim. Somente alguns acreditavam que foi ele quem estava por trás do "Progresso Nacional" o blog onde começou toda essa história de Mentiras, Calunias, Difamações, Ameaças e tantos outros agressões tóxicas ao espírito humano, a todos os que não estão do seu lado e cujo o único objectivo, era ser chamado de rei dos réis da Guiné. Comandou o Progresso Nacional assim como Bin Laden comandou a Al-Qaeda e acabou por fracassar. Pensou, repensou e resolveu voltar novamente ainda com mais TERROR e está a comandar o Guiné Puro tentando levar toda a nação ao abismo assim como o ISIS quer levar a humanidade. Camaradas, Guiné Puro assim como o falecido Progresso Nacional é o reflexo do espirito de DSP, alí é possivel ver tudo e quanto o sujeito é baixo. DSP é um hipócrita e um anarquista moderno. "ACHAS QUE AS NOSSAS MARCHAS SÃO RESULTADO DE VENDAS E COMPRAS?!" essa foi uma das frases da recente publicação que mostram por quem e para que fim, é dirigido o Guiné Puro ou melhor o blog do terror como podem ver já a seguir. Demonstraram mais uma vez claramente que o "MCCI" pertence a DPS, pois uma publicação dessa no próprio blog do ganancioso só pode ser das duas uma: "Boca capli elis ou Foronta passanta e dicidi ca sucundi rostu". Camaradas, Domingos Simões Pereira afundou seu próprio barco devido a sua ganância e complexo de superioridade. "I pirigu pa i faladu ba cuma, el i unicu alguim cu bai escola na Guiné" seu ultimo desejo é "afundar com todos, inclusive o PAIGC". __________PARA A VOSSA CONFIRMAÇÃO, AQUI ESTÁ A PUBLICAÇÃO_________ MARCOS GALINA BARBOSA VAI PERCEBER QUE METEU COM GENTE

data.title: DSP, UM PERIGO GRAVE PARA FUTURO DO PAÍS
data.description: Os meios de comunicação também são as formas de manipulação mais utilizadas pelos poderes políticos, dado o seu impacto social. As informações são manipuladas não apenas tendo em vista omitir factos relevantes, mas também distorcer o conteúdo da informação veiculada, produzir ou forjar a opinião pública, de modo que a mesma se ajuste às ideias dos gananciosos. A única forma dos cidadãos evitarem cair nestes processos de manipulação é tornarem-se mais vigilantes em relação às instituições democráticas e aos órgãos de informação, adoptando uma atitude de permanente reflexão crítica sobre a informação que lhes é fornecida. Na Guiné-Bissau, nos últimos anos, cresceu exponencialmente o número de pessoas mediocres, pessoas sem escrúpulos ligadas à produção de rádios e outros meios de comunicação com influencia na nossa sociedade, gente que apesar da sua enorme influência na sociedade, trabalha na mais completa impunidade e sem qualquer controlo ético/democrático. Obcecado pelo poder, ciente da dificuldade do povo guineense em avaliar informações, ciente do poder dos instrumentos de comunicação, Domingos Simões Pereira (DSP) nunca menosprezou esses instrumentos para atingir seu objectivo, sempre usou-os de forma desonesta como agora está a fazer tudo por tudo para manter no controlo desses veicúlos, mesmo que isso custe a vida dos outros. Governou na corrupção, no nepotismo e no desvios de somas astronómicas do dinheiro de povo, que muito serviria para investimentos na saúde, educação e outros serviços publicos, para beneficiar familiares e amigos. Finge que preocupa com os problemas do país, mas só engana o povo honesto, humilde e trabalhador que infelizmente sofre muito, não sei até quando, devido a sua paciência e tolerância aos governantes como DSP, criminoso travestido em politico que vive na custa de povo e acima de tudo ainda fa-lo refem do próprio suor. Roubou e decepcionou tanto não só aos guineenses assim como a comunidade internacional que sempre acreditou que o sujeito era ideal para ajudar esse povo a sair do ciclo de sofrimento que parece infinito. Foi demitido, não conformou e está a fazer tudo na medida do possível para continuar a complicar a vida dos guineenses. Razão disso é que depois de perder a batalha nos meios de comunicações mais modernos nomeadamente os blogues onde investiu grandes somas do dinheiro de povo, para fazer a lavagem cerebral dos menos instruídos e não só. Fugiu do facebook onde sempre frequentava e comunicava com todos tentado passar a mensagem de um politico moderno e aberto a diálogo/opiniões, mas que afinal era simplesmente um falso modernista. Caiu a mascara e já não consegue enganar ninguem, pois a sua credibilidade está abaixo de zero, para não dizer outra coisa. Camaradas, para conhecimento geral, com o dinheiro roubado que custou suor de povo guineense, DSP decidiu avançar com um outro novo plano maquiavelico, para criar a sua própria estação de rádio. Documento António Aly Silva » aaly.silva@gmail.com » aaly_silva@hotmail.com » Tel. (+245) 668 31 13
data.translatedTitle: DSP, a serious danger to the country's future
data.translatedDescription: The media are also the most used forms of manipulation by political powers, given their social impact. The information is manipulated not only in view of omitting relevant facts, but also distorting the content of the information conveyed, producing or forging public opinion, so that it adjusts to the ideas of the greedy. The only way for citizens to avoid falling into these manipulation processes is to become more vigilant in relation to democratic institutions and information bodies, adopting an attitude of permanent critical reflection on the information provided to them. In Guinea-Bissau, in recent years, the number of mediocre people has grown exponentially, unscrupulous people linked to the production of radios and other media with influence on our society, people who despite their enormous influence on society, work on more complete impunity and without any ethical/democratic control. Obsessed with power, aware of the difficulty of the Guinean people in evaluating information, aware of the power of communication instruments, Domingos Simões Pereira (DSP) has never belittled these instruments to achieve their goal, always used them dishonestly how it is now doing everything to keep in control of these vehicles, even if it costs the lives of others. He ruled in corruption, nepotism and deviations from astronomical sums of people's money, which would serve much for investments in health, education and other public services, to benefit family and friends. It pretends to worry about the problems of the country, but only deceives the honest, humble and worker people who are unfortunately suffering a lot, I don't know how long, due to their patience and tolerance to rulers like DSP, a politician-crossed criminal who lives at the expense of people and above all they still do so. He stole and disappointed so much not only to the Guineans as well as the international community that always believed that the subject was ideal to help these people get out of the suffering cycle that seems infinite. He was fired, did not conform and is doing everything as far as possible to continue to complicate the life of the Guineans. Reason for this is that after losing the battle in the most modern media, namely the blogs where it invested great sums of people's money, to make the brainwash of the less educated and beyond. He ran away from Facebook where he always attended and communicated with everyone attempted to give the message of a modern politician and open to dialogue/opinions, but after all he was simply a false modernist. The mask fell and can no longer fool anyone, because its credibility is below zero, not to say something else. Comrades, for general knowledge, with the stolen money that cost Guinean people sweat, DSP decided to advance with another new Machiavellian plan, to create his own radio station. data.title: Islamitische Ontwikkelingsbank keurt financiering voor nieuwbouw AZP goed
data.description: De Islamitische Ontwikkelingsbank (IsDB) heeft tijdens haar 360e Raad van Bestuursvergadering in Algerije, groen licht gegeven voor de financiering van verschillende projecten in haar lidstaten. In totaal werd meer dan US$ 1,32 miljard aan ontwikkelingsfinanciering goedgekeurd, bedoeld ter bevordering van inclusieve groei, klimaatbestendigheid en economische vooruitgang.

data.translatedDescription: During its 360th board meeting in Algeria, the Islamic Development Bank (ISDB) has given the green light for the financing of various projects in its Member States. In total, more than US $ 1.32 billion in development financing was approved, intended to promote inclusive growth, climate resistance and economic progress.
